Package net.alexanderdev.lightdrive.graphics

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BlendOp
    A FunctionalInterface which is used in color blend operations, and defines the rule(s) for determining the values.
    GrayscaleOp
    An interface which defines an algorithm for gray-scale operations.
    Renderable
    An interface that defines behaviors that any object that is visually representable on a Viewable should implement.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Animation
    A class which represents a single Sprite based animation.
    ColorX
    An extension of Java's own Color class, which contains constants for all defined CSS3 colors, as well as a set of methods for unique color modifications that build upon Java's Color.brighter() and Color.darker().
    CSS3Colors
    A collection of ColorX definitions for all CSS3 colors.
    GraphicsX
    A class which encapsulates the functionality of Graphics2D, while adding or modifying methods for more convenient drawing abilities.

    Such additions and modifications include: Drawing text which is aligned relative to a Rectangle Drawing text which takes new-line characters into consideration Drawing text with it's characters spaced out Drawing text from the top-left corner, instead of the baseline Drawing images without the need for an ImageObserver Drawing images that are scaled to fit within a Rectangle Getting and setting Font attributes separately Setting the color with a '0xAARRGGBB' formatted integer color value
    Sprite
    A wrapper class for BufferedImage that contains multiple methods for advanced color manipulation.
    SpriteSheet
    A class that represents a two dimensional array of Sprites generated from a Sprite.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Animation.Style
    Lists four styles of animation, all of which alter the order of appearance of the frames in the Animation.
    BlendMode
    An enumeration for specifying a blend mode for certain color operations.
    GraphicsX.TextAlign  
    GrayscaleMode
    An enumeration of most standard gray-scale modes, and their respective algorithms, in the form of GrayscaleOps.
